plan.plan_title: Overcrowding Alert During Flash Sale (Phoenix Marketcity)

steps.details: Control entry points and temporarily stop new entrants until congestion reduces.
Use all available egress routes and guide shoppers via staff to prevent choke points.
Position marshals at stairwells and key junctions to manage directional flow.
Create secure holding zones outside the mall to stage dispersed crowds.
Manage promotion timing to reduce simultaneous demand and future risk.
Immediate medical triage for reported injuries; dispatch ambulances as required.
Prevent re-entry until safety clearance and avoid repeat panic triggers.
Determine source of false alarm and take corrective action (staff training, signage, announcements).
Offer counseling support for traumatized individuals and families.
Assess evacuation flow and improve signage and staff training to reduce stampede risk.
Keep designated perimeter lanes clear for ambulance and fire services at all times.
Control outbound traffic to avoid gridlock and coordinate with tow operators to remove illegal parking.
Adjust signal timings and enforce closures to prioritize emergency ingress/egress.
Designate off-site pickup points to relieve pressure on mall access roads.
Conduct post-incident review to update emergency response and false-alarm handling procedures.
